pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.1: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.2: the monks from the group of seventeen were playing in the water of the river Aciravatī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.3: Just then, while King Pasenadi of Kosala was up in his magnificent stilt house with queen Mallikā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.4: he saw the monks from the group of seventeen playing in the river.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.6: “Mallikā, these perfected ones are playing in the water.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.7: “Great king, no doubt the Buddha hasn’t laid down a rule.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.8: Either that, or these monks are ignorant.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.10: “How can the Buddha find out about these monks playing in the water without me telling him?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.11: Having sent for those monks, King Pasenadi gave them a large lump of sugar, saying,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.12: “Venerables, please give this lump of sugar to the Buddha.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.13: The monks took the lump of sugar, went to the Buddha,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.15: “Venerable Sir, this lump of sugar is a gift from King Pasenadi.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.16: “But, monks, where did you see the king?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.17: “From the river Aciravatī, while playing in the water.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.19: “Foolish men, how can you play in water?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.21: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.22.1: ‘If a monk plays in water, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.1.2: if, aiming to have fun, he immerses himself or emerges on the surface or swims, in water that is more than ankle deep, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.1: If he is playing in water, and he perceives that he is, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.2: If he is playing in water, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.3: If he is playing in water, but he does not perceive that he is, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.4: If he is playing in water less than ankle deep, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.5: If he is playing in a boat in water, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.6: If he strikes the water with his hand, with his foot, with a stick, or with a stone, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.7: If he plays with water in a vessel, or with conjee, milk, buttermilk, dye, urine, or mud in a vessel, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.8: If he is not playing in water, but he perceives that he is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.9: If he is not playing in water, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.10: If he is not playing in water, and he does not perceive that he is, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.2: if he is not aiming to have fun;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.3: if, when there is something to be done, he enters the water and then immerses himself or emerges on the surface or swims;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.4: if, while crossing a body of water, he immerses himself or emerges on the surface or swims;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.7: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.8: The training rule on playing, the third, is finished.
